intro: Sannantha crenulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sannantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, often arranged in umbels, and it blooms during the cooler months. Sannantha crenulata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in local remedies.
